summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 5450, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twelfth Avenue and Twelfth Avenue North, in the City of Seattle, from the south line of the Nagle Donation Claim to the North boundary of the Frank Pontius and Lincoln Pontius Additions, by grading, sidewalking and parking said avenue in accordance with a similar plans as said Twelfth Avenue is now improved south of East Madison Street; inclusing also the grading, sidewalking and parking on like plan, of an approach from the North line of East Madison Street to the South end of this improvement, and providing for the payment therefor for in installments and establishing a fund for such payment by the levying and collection of special assessments upon the property benefited by the improvement, and providing for the issuance of bonds as authorized by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled, "An act relating to the internal improvements in cities, authorizing the issuance and collection of bonds upon the property benefited by local improvements, and declaring an emergency," approved March 9th, 1893, and under the provisions of Ordinance No. 3349, approved May 7th, 1894, as amended by Ordinance No. 3440, approved July 11th, 1894, and Ordinance No. 4492, approved March 5th, 1897, and the City Charter as now in force."
